alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bath, Fleming and central Rowan Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tilton, or over Flemingsburg, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Poplar Plains and Pebble around 500 PM EDT. Wallingford around 505 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hillsboro, Goddard, Oakley, Grange City, Plummers Landing, Ringos Mills, Muses Mills, Sharkey, Hilda, Waltz, Munson, Hays Crossing, Cranston and Ramey. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 130 and 147. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
